def_cn: 英里(等于1,760 码或约等于1.6公里)
def_en: A mile is a unit of distance equal to 1,760 yards or approximately 1.6 kilometres.
Miles is used, especially in the expression miles away, to refer to a long distance.

def_cn: 很大的程度（强调区别或目标与现实的差距）
def_en: Miles or a mile is used with the meaning 'very much' in order to emphasize the difference between two things or qualities, or the difference between what you aimed to do and what you actually achieved.

def_cn: 思想不集中;开小差；走神
def_en: If you say that someone is miles away, you mean that they are unaware of what is happening around them because they are thinking about something else.
If you say that someone is willing to go the extra mile, you mean that they are willing to make a special effort to do or achieve something.
If you say that you can see or recognize something a mile off, you are emphasizing that it is very obvious and easy to recognize.

def_cn: (因极度害怕或不愿面对)避而远之，跑得远远的
def_en: If you say that someone would run a mile when faced with a particular situation, you mean that they would be very frightened or unwilling to deal with it.
If you say that something or someone sticks out a mile or stands out a mile, you are emphasizing that they are very obvious and easy to recognize.
